title: Farmers' Guide to High-quality Seed Production

tasks.task: Setup and use of a showcase to exhibit boxwood plants.
subtasks: Position boxwood plants in the showcase.
Ensure the boxwood plants are at an appropriate height and angle for display.
Adjust showcase lighting to highlight the boxwood plants.
Organize the plants in a aesthetically pleasing manner within the showcase.
Identify the location for the tree planting.
Prepare the soil by tilling or digging holes.
Carefully remove the tree from its container or bare-root state.
Plant the tree in the prepared hole, ensuring proper depth.
Backfill the hole with soil, tamping down to eliminate air pockets.
Water the newly planted tree.
Inspect trees for signs of disease or pests.
Prune trees to promote health and shape.
Apply fertilizer to the trees.
Mulch around the base of the trees to retain moisture and suppress weeds.

tasks.task: Operating a forklift when moving supplies on a farm.
subtasks: Conduct a pre-operational check of the forklift.
Drive the forklift to the destination area.
Position the forklift close to the items to be moved.
Engage the forklift's hydraulic system to lift the items.
Carefully maneuver the lift to avoid tipping or damaging the items.
Lower the items into position.
Repeat as necessary for multiple items.

tasks.task: Assisting someone with using a handsaw.
subtasks: Explain the appropriate technique for using a handsaw.
Loan the handsaw to the person needing it.
Demonstrate the proper grip and sawing motion.
Provide safety instructions and ensure the user is prepared.

tasks.task: Assisting with the harvesting of apples from a tree.
subtasks: Climb the ladder to reach the apples.
Carefully remove the apples without damaging the tree or fruit.
Collect the harvested apples in baskets or bags.
Descend the ladder safely.
